description.bonds: A bond is a digital debt instrument where issuers raise capital from investors with predefined terms, enabled by blockchain for automated issuance, transparent tracking, and streamlined settlement.
description.cryptocurrencies: Cryptocurrency is a digital asset secured by cryptography, enabling decentralized, peer-to-peer transactions and programmable value transfer on blockchain networks.
description.deposits: A deposit is a sum of money placed into an account or escrow, which on blockchain can be tokenized for secure, transparent, and programmable custody or transaction settlement.
description.equities: Equity represents ownership in an asset or company, which on blockchain can be tokenized to enable fractional ownership, transparent governance, and efficient transferability.
description.funds: A fund is a pooled investment vehicle managed to achieve specific financial goals, which on blockchain can be tokenized for real-time transparency, programmable asset management, and automated compliance.
description.stablecoins: A stablecoin is a blockchain-based digital asset pegged to a stable value, such as a fiat currency, designed to minimize volatility and enable reliable, on-chain transactions and settlements.

description.bonds: A bond manager can reduce the total supply through bond redemption at maturity or early repurchase programs.
description.cryptocurrencies: A supply manager can burn existing cryptocurrency tokens to decrease the total supply.
description.deposits: A supply manager can burn existing deposits, provided sufficient collateral is available.
description.equities: An equity manager can reduce the total supply of shares through a buyback program or capital reduction.
description.funds: A fund manager can reduce the total supply through fund redemption at maturity or early repurchase programs.
description.stablecoins: A supply manager can burn existing stablecoins, provided sufficient collateral is available.

description.bonds: A bond manager can issue new bonds through primary issuance or tap issuance with defined face value and maturity.
description.cryptocurrencies: A asset manager can mint new assets according to the tokenomics plan and emission schedule.
description.deposits: A supply manager can mint new deposits, provided sufficient collateral is available.
description.equities: An equity manager can issue new shares through various mechanisms like rights issues, private placements, or stock splits.
description.funds: A fund manager can issue new funds through primary issuance or tap issuance with defined face value and maturity.
description.stablecoins: A supply manager can mint new stablecoins, provided sufficient collateral is available.

description.deposits: A supply manager needs to refresh and verify the collateral backing the deposit. This ensures the asset remains fully collateralized at all times.
description.stablecoins: A supply manager needs to refresh and verify the collateral backing the stablecoin. This ensures the asset remains fully collateralized at all times.

fields.bonds-price: Price of the underlying asset multiplied by the face value
fields.collateral-proof-expiration-info: From this point the collateral proof is invalid
fields.collateral-proof-validity-info: How long the collateral proof is valid for
fields.committed-collateral-ratio-info: The ratio of the collateral committed to the total supply of the asset
fields.creator: Creator
fields.max-supply-info: The maximum amount of assets that can be issued
fields.name: Name
fields.ownership-concentration-info: Percentage owned by the top 5 holders
fields.proven-collateral-info: The amount of collateral that has been proven to be held by the asset
fields.required-collateral-threshold-info: The amount of collateral that must be proven
fields.total-burned-info: Amount of assets permanently removed from circulation
fields.total-holders-info: Amount of addresses currently holding the assets
fields.total-supply-info: The total supply of the asset

topinfo-description.bond: A bond is a debt instrument through which an issuer raises capital from investors, agreeing to repay the principal with interest over a defined period. When issued on blockchain, bonds become programmable assets with transparent terms, automated compliance, and efficient end-to-end lifecycle management from issuance to settlement.
topinfo-description.cryptocurrency: Cryptocurrency is a form of digital asset that uses cryptographic techniques to secure transactions and operate independently of central authorities. On blockchain-based platforms, cryptocurrencies enable real-time, trustless value exchange and serve as a foundation for programmable financial instruments and tokenized assets.
topinfo-description.deposit: A deposit is the act of placing funds into a financial account, typically for safekeeping, future use, or to fulfill a contractual obligation. On blockchain platforms, deposits can be represented as digital tokens, enabling automated verification, conditional release, and auditable custody throughout the transaction lifecycle.
topinfo-description.equity: Equity refers to the ownership interest in a company or asset, typically entitling the holder to a share of profits and voting rights. When tokenized on blockchain, equity can be issued, managed, and transferred with programmable rules, improving access, liquidity, and operational efficiency in ownership markets.
topinfo-description.fund: A fund aggregates capital from multiple investors to invest in a portfolio of assets according to a defined strategy and management structure. Tokenizing funds on blockchain enables granular ownership tracking, efficient distribution of returns, and streamlined operations through smart contracts and real-time reporting.
topinfo-description.stablecoin: A stablecoin is a type of cryptocurrency engineered to maintain a stable value, often backed by reserves like fiat currencies or other assets. On blockchain platforms, stablecoins provide a dependable medium of exchange and store of value, facilitating seamless, low-volatility transactions and programmable financial operations.

topinfo-title.cryptocurrency: A customizable and secure digital asset
topinfo-title.deposit: Secure and compliant digital deposit management
topinfo-title.fund: Digital asset for institutional fund management
topinfo-title.stablecoin: A secure and collateralized digital currency

auth.accounts-description: Manage your currently signed in accounts.
auth.accounts-instructions: Sign in to an additional account.
auth.avatar-description: Click on the avatar to upload a custom one from your files.
auth.avatar-instructions: An avatar is optional but strongly recommended.
auth.backup-code-placeholder: Enter one of your backup codes. Once used, each code can only be used once and will be invalidated after use.
auth.backup-codes-description: Save these backup codes in a secure place. You can use them to access your account if you lose your two-factor authentication method.
auth.change-password-description: Enter your current password and a new password.
auth.delete-account-description: Permanently remove your account and all of its contents. This WILL remove your access to your private key and you WILL lose access to your assets! This action is not reversible, so please continue with caution.
auth.delete-account-email: Please check your email to verify the deletion of your account.
auth.delete-account-instructions: Please confirm the deletion of your account. This action is not reversible, so please continue with caution.
auth.delete-account-not-fresh: You must be recently logged in to delete your account.
auth.delete-account-verify: Please check your email to verify the deletion of your account.
auth.disabled-credentials-description: Choose a provider to login to your account
auth.email-description: Enter the email address you want to use to log in.
auth.email-instructions: Please use a valid email address.
auth.email-verification: Please check your email for the verification link.
auth.email-verify-change: Please check your email to verify the change.
auth.forgot-password-description: Enter your email to reset your password
auth.forgot-password-email: Check your email for the password reset link.
auth.magic-link-description: Enter your email to receive a magic link
auth.magic-link-email: Check your email for the magic link
auth.name: Name
auth.name-description: Please enter your full name, or a display name.
auth.passkeys-description: Manage your passkeys for secure access.
auth.passkeys-instructions: Securely access your account without a password.
auth.providers-description: Connect your account with a third-party service.
auth.recover-account-description: Please enter a backup code to access your account
auth.sessions-description: Manage your active sessions and revoke access.
auth.set-password-description: Check your email to set your password.
auth.set-password-email-sent: Check your email to set your password.
auth.sign-in-description: Enter your email below to login to your account
auth.sign-in-username-description: Enter your username below to login to your account
auth.sign-up-description: Enter your information to create an account
auth.sign-up-email: Check your email for the verification link.
auth.two-factor-card-description: Add an extra layer of security to your account.
auth.two-factor-description: Please enter your one-time password to continue
auth.two-factor-disable-instructions: Please enter your password to disable 2FA.
auth.two-factor-enable-instructions: Please enter your password to enable 2FA
auth.two-factor-totp-label: Scan the QR Code with your Authenticator
auth.username-description: Enter the username you want to use to log in.
auth.verify-your-email-description: Please verify your email address. Check your inbox for the verification email. If you haven't received the email, click the button below to resend.

secret-codes.description: These one-time-use codes can verify transactions or recover your wallet. Store them securely, like in a password manager or written down. If lost, recovery will be difficult.
secret-codes.title: Backup your secure codes

select-method.description: Let's make sure your wallet is safe. Pick the security method that works best for you. It only takes a few quick steps to set up and protect your wallet.
select-method.title: Preferred wallet security

authenticator-app.description: Scan the QR code below using your preferred app (like Google Authenticator or Authy). Once scanned, the app will generate time-based codes. These codes are required to verify your wallet transactions and keep your account secure.
authenticator-app.title: Set up an Authenticator app

pincode.description: Create a secure 6 digit PIN for your wallet. This PIN will be required whenever you authorize transactions.
pincode.title: Enter a Pincode

setup.description: To keep your wallet safe, you need to finish setting up its security. Either set up your preferred verification method or download your security codes to ensure you're always in control. Let's get it done now to protect your assets.
setup.title: Complete your wallet security

summary.description: You've successfully secured your wallet. Your transactions are now protected, and your recovery codes ensure you're always in control. You're all set to start using your wallet securely.
summary.title: Your wallet is secured!

set-pincode-dialog.description: Enter a 6-digit pincode to secure your wallet.
set-pincode-dialog.password-description: Enter your password to setup your pincode.

change-role.description: Select a new role for {userName}. This will change their permissions in the system.
change-role.self-change-warning: Changing your own role may restrict your access to this page.
change-role.title: Change user role

remove-kyc-status.description: Are you sure you want to remove KYC verification for ${userName}?
remove-kyc-status.title: Remove KYC status

set-kyc-status.description: Are you sure you want to verify KYC for ${userName}?
set-kyc-status.title: Verify KYC

transaction-history-last-month.description: Showing transactions over the last month
transaction-history-last-month.title: Transactions volume / day

transaction-history-last-year.description: Showing transactions over the last year
transaction-history-last-year.title: Transactions volume / month

table.not-enough-permissions: You need to be an admin or a user manager for this asset to change permissions.
table.title: Token permissions

mica.description: Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) is the EU's comprehensive regulatory framework designed to regulate cryptocurrencies, stablecoins, and other digital assets, providing legal certainty for crypto-asset issuers and service providers.
mica.name: MiCA

amounts.description: Enter the asset and amount of assets that you wish to exchange.
amounts.title: Amount to exchange

configuration.auto-execute-description: Automatically execute the settlement on last approval.
configuration.expiry-description: The time until which you will not be able to refund assets from the settlement. If the settlement is not executed, you can refund your assets after this time.
configuration.past-expiry-error: Expiry must be in the future.
configuration.secret-description: Please save this secret securely. You will need it to unlock the assets received from the settlement.
configuration.title: Configuration

description.xvp: An XvP (Delivery vs Payment or Payment vs Payment) Settlement enables an atomic exchange of assets between parties. It allows you to reliably exchange assets with other users without the need for a third party.

summary.configuration-description: The configuration for the XvP Settlement
summary.description: Review the XvP Settlement details. Ensure the receiver, amounts, expiry and secret are correct.
summary.offer-description: The amount of assets you are offering to the user. This amount will be locked.
summary.request-description: The amount of assets you are requesting from the user.
summary.title: Summary

user.description: Select the user wallet you wish to exchange assets with.
user.title: User

xvp.total-price-description: The total price of the assets involved in the settlement.
xvp.auto-execute-description: Automatically execute the settlement on last approval.
xvp.approve-xvp-settlement-description: Grant allowances to the XvP Settlement contract for the assets that will be transferred from your wallet.
xvp.approve-description: The XvP Settlement contract will be granted approval to transfer the assets configured in the settlement on your behalf. Then the settlement will be marked as approved by you.
xvp.execute-xvp-settlement-description: Processes all approved asset flows in this settlement.
xvp.execute-xvp-settlement-summary: Execute this settlement to transfer assets between parties as defined in the settlement flows.
xvp.cancel-xvp-settlement-summary: Cancelling this settlement will permanently prevent it from being executed, and this action cannot be reversed. A new settlement will have to be created to exchange assets.
xvp.cancel-xvp-settlement-description: Cancel this settlement to prevent it from being executed.
